result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Clerk sent Petition for Appointment of Counsel to defendant to complete and return to the Court, along with a self-addressed envelope.

No contact with V1 in OPD report 22-26927 or V1 in OPD report 22-27881 or the 700 BL of W. South Park Ave. Child visitation through 3rd party. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. Take medications prescribed by physician as prescribed.
8/22/22 and 09/08/22 Court amends bond to allow no violent contact with V1 at medical appointments.

records.addlTxt:
8:57 AM Defendant ROBERT M. ERHARD in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of time limits. Defendant re-applied for SPD appointed attorney. Court appointed paperwork given to DE. Defendant requests to modify bond, lift no contact. Victim addresses the court. The State objects. Court denies motion to modify bond, but allows no violent contact with V1 at medical appointments. Record closed @ 9:10.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
